page.title: 06HOUSING-THE RURAL VILLAGES
page.content: The surrounding villages have kept their seperate identities.Durham County Council decided to make Heselden a D category village as the houses were old and had few facilities.The villages fought the idea,the Council relented and kept the village alive.The Wellfield area of mining,Wingate,is a mixture of private and council housing built from the 1930's to 1985.Old Shotton is an old agricultural settlement with 18th century houses an Hall.Although the new town of Peterlee has enveloped it,it still retains its own identity. Castle Eden another rural village,is a scattered community of 18th and 19th century houses of historical interest, many large homes in private grounds and some council properties.It is regarded by local people as a desirable place to live.
